meanings.definition: To look quickly and furtively at something, especially through a small opening or from a hidden location.
meanings.sent1: She was peeping through the keyhole to see who was outside.
meanings.sent2: The cat was peeping out from behind the curtains.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was peeping into the birdhouse, curious about its inhabitants.
meanings.sent4: The sun was peeping through the clouds after a rainy day.
meanings.sent5: The child was peeping over the fence to catch a glimpse of the puppies next door.

meanings.definition: A quick or furtive glance or look.
meanings.sent1: He caught a quick peeping at the mysterious figure in the dark alley.
meanings.sent2: The peeping from the stranger made her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The little girl's peeping at the birthday cake hinted at her excitement.
meanings.sent4: The peeping of the stars through the night sky was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The peeping of the squirrel from the tree branch caught everyone's attention.
